alert.note: Alert for Macon; Southern Jackson; Transylvania (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 25 at 2:35PM EST until January 27 at 1:01PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Georgia, including the following areas, Habersham and Rabun, western North Carolina, including the following areas, Macon, Southern Jackson and Transylvania, and upstate South Carolina, including the following areas, Oconee Mountains and Pickens Mountains. * WHEN...Until midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of moderate to heavy rain are expected over the watch area through this evening. Storm total rainfall of 2.5 to 4 inches with locally higher amounts are expected. This rain is expected to fall relatively evenly through this evening, so stream rises are expected to be gradual. However, isolated flash flooding cannot be ruled out. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on current forecasts. Please monitor the latest forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
